Questions! Why is the Starlight Crystal not mentioned at all in his lore? Without some context, his story and his playable character have relatively little cohesion with one another.
Of all the people to drop a point and click stun from, why Taric? Bottom lane has some of the most notoriously cancerous mobile champs like Kalista, Lucian, Quinn, and sometimes Graves, and against them, landing skill shots is like throwing rocks at rabbits.
Aside from those, I love everything about the new Taric and you guys did a super fantastic job and you have really listened to his fans and taken him in the direction we've always wanted him to go! I also nominate that if his Cosmic Radiance proves too unbalanced, you return his old Radiance, but with more visual flash, as that combined with Bastion will be pretty amazing.
Final question, just for posterity: Can we get a confirmation that Taric is gay? Please?

Do you REALLY want characters to be explicitly defined by their sexual orientation, even when it's not germane to their purpose? I feel like the guy might easily have been bi or gay when he was a man, but he's one of those meta humans with a celestial being riding shotgun now, so the scope of who and how he loves just got really wide and ethereal.

If he's gay in your heart as a Taric fan than I'd just say he's gay. *shrug* Don't let Riot's lack of shoehorning love scenes into war stories hold you back, mate!

Do we *need* to know that Anivia froze Gnar, or that Lissandra was blinded by a bear, or that Miss Fortune's first name is Sarah? Do we need taunts, lore, or anything other than numbers? These things make the characters more human and relatable, and having a gay character does the same thing. You probably won't really understand needing someone to relate to in your games until you yourself fall into a social group that isn't represented.
Plus, announcing he is gay is not defining him by his sexuality. He's defined by his fall from grace and ascent to becoming an Aspect.  Lucian is more defined by his straight sexuality with his vengeance for his wife than Taric would be if he was announced as gay.

Oleandervine, you're awesome! I keep trying to tell straight people that representation matters. Why can't LGBT people have a piece of the pie? Why can't we exist in this mythical universe? I want our stories told. Straight people literally are represented by every character in the game. Why can't we just have one? Why is it all this fake concern for "not having characters explicitly defined by their sexual orientation" when WE want one character? 

Representation matters to those of us who aren't always in the game. I know that whenever Riot has released a person of color as a champ, I play the hell out of them. I feel that connection with the game and the escape of fantasy element. When Ekko was released that was when I felt represented fully. He was a darkskin, Black champion who wanted to have fun and be seen. Give me more of that.

  (BTW straight gamers, Taric vogues in his dance animation and I need you to google what that is before asking whether or not Taric is gay)

Just wanted to hop on and say something really quick (well that was my original intention but this turned into an essay)

While I'm totally for LGBT peeps being represented in games, I don't really think Taric should be the first one coming out of the closet. His (and ezreal's) gayness has been a joke for ages, and I'm not sure I'd want the first openly gay character in league to be some hypersexualized guy obsessed with beauty and style. Is it forbidden for gay people to act stereotypically gay? no, but I'm wary that Taric's depth as a character will be lost and transformed into just another gay joke if riot offhandedly mentions he's gay (not to mention that would make no sense within his current lore)

In fact, I'm glad riot isn't making his sexuality a big part of his story, because it's a statement that there's more to him than being a fruitcake. No, I want the first gay champion to be someone unaffiliated with all the stale jokes people have been making about we LGBT people for decades, and I want their sexuality to just casually fit into their story, just like it does in real life.

Obviously, there's room for romance in league of legends, and obviously overt LGBT stuff has been avoided by riot for a long time for less than stellar reasons (not all of their audience is as accepting as coastside NA and western europe, and if graves can't even haVE A CIGAR I doubt riot would be comfortable having an overt queer relationship in the game).

But if they're finally going to breach that gap, I want them to do it right.

I'm all for an openly gay character being represented in League.  I just don't want it to be Taric.  He IS a walking camp trope and he serves to divert the trope more by not being confirmed gay than he does by skipping through summoners rift.  He solidifies the idea that being gay means you're frivolous and dainty, even as a massive hulking fighter.  Further, he'd only help to push the idea of being gentle hearted or interested in beauty as being a distinctly homosexual or feminine trait.  Which is stupid.  If anything, I'd prefer someone like Darius, Jarvan, Swain, or Miss Fortune to be confirmed gay.  Someone who isn't defined by it, just has it as a part of their lives.  Representation is important, I agree- but it's also important to consider how you're being represented.

I just have to say, the discussion on this subject is of way better caliber than I expected from the internet. It is articulate, thoughtful, and respectful. Cookies to everyone. As a person who identifies as outside the heterosexual norm, this is a breath of fresh air and a glimmer of hope for better representation and inclusion of diversity in fantasy and gaming.

I feel that these pieces of lore have more to do with giving the champions a motivation to their actions, rather than character building. Should Taric's motivation be about yearning for Ezreal, for instance, I feel that defining his sexuality is important then to his motivation. 

Not that more character building is a bad thing, but I applaud the method by which Riot handles characters expressing their sexuality, in hints. For instance, the new Taric splash for the armor of the 5th age shows Ezreal rather plainly, hinting of an acknowledgement of the ship. Or lets say, Garen's special voice lines with Katarina too, its a hint, but not official. This way, Riot is neutral and attempts to appease most bases without limiting anything, by leaving hints for people to explore with their imaginations.

Riot responded on the Brazilian boards when Gnar came out and they were doing his Q&A there that Anivia foresaw a cataclysmic event in the future, and that Gnar's unique condition would be crucial to saving the Freljord, so she froze him so he would be preserved for when that even occurred. 
As for Lissandra, I don't recall where, possibly during the Freljord event ages ago, but it was stated that on attempting to conquer the bear tribes of which Volibear is a part of, she was blinded in a fight with one of their elders and was forced to retreat.

I feel like Taric would be more pansexual though. Like he doesn't really have a preference, he just loves things that are beautiful. I feel like he sees beauty in all things and could be easily attracted to any man, woman, etc that he found aesthetically pleasing. That being said Ez is definitely beautiful like a delicate flower ;) and he want to explore probably gives Taric a sense of nostalgia from when he was human.

You know, it's funny. The old Taric seemed to me like he was probably a homosexual, but with the rework, I have to agree with you. Now, he just seems like he loves beauty in general, and doesn't really take gender or the like into account.

But he's not a negative stereotype. Sure, he's got stereotypical aspects to him, but then, so does everyone else. Taric is a man who was a high ranking official in the army. He fell from his position because he valued life and beauty above warmongering. He was banished, yet rose from his exile and braved a mountain that has killed many men before, and he bested a god to become a demigod. That's a pretty damn positive representation of a gay character.
